creator: brad@javaplant.com
text:
If I set declare to true in the constructor of a ValueInfo object that supports
a tag, the code generation correctly declares and instantiates desired variable
in generated code.  If I set declare to false, the code generated is incorrect;
a correctly named reference appears in the generated code but no declaration is
ever made and so the compiler fails to compile the generated code.

creator: william.barker@wilshire.com
text:
If declare=false, it is the responsibility of the page to declare the variable 
(e.g. in a scriptlet or an enclosing Tag).
